an4.160:4.1.pli: Cattārome, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an4.160:4.1.en: These four things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an4.160:4.5.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an4.160:4.5.en: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an4.160:5.2.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an4.160:5.2.en: This is the second thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an4.160:6.3.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an4.160:6.3.en: This is the third thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an4.160:7.4.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an4.160:7.4.en: This is the fourth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an4.160:7.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattantīti.
an4.160:7.5.en: These are four things that lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4
16. Faculties
160. The Training of a Holy One

an1.114:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yo evaṁ saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, pamādo.
an1.114:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching like negligence.

an1.114:1.2.pli: Pamādo, bhikkhave, saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattatī”ti.
an1.114:1.2.en: Negligence leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.”

an1.116:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yo evaṁ saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, kosajjaṁ.
an1.116:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching like laziness.

an1.116:1.2.pli: Kosajjaṁ, bhikkhave, saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattatī”ti.
an1.116:1.2.en: Laziness leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.”

an1.118-128:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yo evaṁ saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, mahicchatā …pe… appicchatā … asantuṭṭhitā … santuṭṭhitā … ayonisomanasikāro … yonisomanasikāro … asampajaññaṁ … sampajaññaṁ … pāpamittatā … kalyāṇamittatā … anuyogo akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ, ananuyogo kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ.
an1.118-128:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching like having many wishes … having few wishes … lack of contentment … contentment … improper attention … proper attention … lack of situational awareness … situational awareness … bad friends … good friends … pursuing bad habits and not good habits.

an1.118-128:1.2.pli: Anuyogo, bhikkhave, akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ, ananuyogo kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattatī”ti.
an1.118-128:1.2.en: Pursuing bad habits and not good habits leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.”

an5.155:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an5.155:1.1.en: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.155:1.5.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an5.155:1.5.en: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.155:5.2.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an5.155:5.2.en: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.155:5.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an5.155:5.3.en: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
16. The True Teaching
155. The Decline of the True Teaching (2nd)

an5.156:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an5.156:1.1.en: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.156:1.5.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an5.156:1.5.en: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.156:5.4.pli: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
an5.156:5.4.en: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.156:5.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an5.156:5.5.en: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
16. The True Teaching
156. The Decline of the True Teaching (3rd)

an5.154:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an5.154:1.1.en: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an5.154:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an5.154:1.4.en: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
16. The True Teaching
154. The Decline of the True Teaching (1st)

sn16.13:4.1.pli: Pañca khome, kassapa, okkamaniyā dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
sn16.13:4.1.en: There are five detrimental things that lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

sn16.13:4.4.pli: ime kho, kassapa, pañca okkamaniyā dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
sn16.13:4.4.en: These five detrimental things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 16
1. Kassapa
13. The Counterfeit of the True Teaching

an2.20:1.1.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
an2.20:1.1.en: “These two things, mendicants, lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

an2.20:1.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattantī”ti.
an2.20:1.5.en: These two things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
